message.raw:
Added a new update mode to the novatech DDS9m.

Now with the update_mode='asynchronous' instantiation argument, the novatech can
be used with an ordinary clocking source - it will load the next value of its
table on each falling edge and update its output asynchonously within the next
100us. This currenly results in incorrect output, and requires the PulseBlaster
to produce shorter clock pulses to make it more accurate. This is because, since
the novatech updates on the falling edge, the falling edge needs to be soon after
a rising edge if we are to minimise inaccuracy from this.

In the present implementation the falling edge can be arbitrarily late, making
this mode of operation unreliable (well, more unreliable than the 100us of delay
it gives regardless).
